sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The clock statement is used to determine the amount of time since a program (process) started running. Variable c is assigned the number of milliseconds since the program started running.
sections.text_content: The clock statement is used to determine the amount of time since a program (process) started running. Variable c is assigned the number of milliseconds since the program started running.
sections.mdown_content: The **clock** statement is used to determine the amount of time since a program (process) started running. Variable _c _is assigned the number of milliseconds since the program started running.

sections.title: Example
code:
var timeRunning : int
        clock (timeRunning)
        put "This program has run ", timeRunning, " milliseconds"
sections.raw_content: This program tells you how much time it has used.
sections.text_content: This program tells you how much time it has used.
sections.mdown_content: This program tells you how much time it has used.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: On Apple Macintoshes, the hardware resolution of duration is in units of 17 milliseconds (1/60-th of a second).
sections.text_content: On Apple Macintoshes, the hardware resolution of duration is in units of 17 milliseconds (1/60-th of a second).
sections.mdown_content: On Apple Macintoshes, the hardware resolution of duration is in units of 17 milliseconds (1/60-th of a second).

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
delay, time, sysclock, wallclock and date statements.

See also predefined unit Time.
sections.text_content:
delay, time, sysclock, wallclock and date statements.
See also predefined unit Time.
sections.mdown_content:
